title: Platform Overview
content: Our EdTech platform offers self-paced and instructor-led courses across technology, business, and creative domains. Learners can access video lectures, readings, quizzes, and projects.

title: Course Enrollment Process
content: To enroll, navigate to the course catalog, select a course, and click Enroll Now. Free courses are instantly accessible; paid courses require payment before access.

title: Course Structure
content: Each course is divided into Modules, and each Module contains Lessons. A typical course has 4-10 modules with 3-8 lessons each, including videos, readings, and exercises.

title: Self-Paced Learning
content: Self-paced courses let learners study on their own schedule with no fixed deadlines unless a time-limited exam applies. Learners can pause and resume anytime.

title: Instructor-Led Courses
content: Instructor-led courses follow a fixed weekly schedule with live sessions, assignment deadlines, and instructor interaction via discussion forums and office hours.

title: Video Lectures
content: Video lectures are pre-recorded and on demand. Learners can pause, rewind, and replay. Transcripts and closed captions are available. Average video length is 5-15 minutes.

title: Course Materials Access
content: Once enrolled, all materials including videos, readings, and downloads are accessible from the My Learning dashboard. Materials remain available for 1 year post-enrollment unless stated otherwise.

title: Course Prerequisites
content: Some courses list prerequisites on their course page. Prerequisites are advisory not technically enforced but strongly recommended for best learning outcomes.

title: Discussion Forums
content: Each course has a discussion forum where learners ask questions and collaborate. Instructors and TAs monitor forums and respond within 48 hours.

title: Course Ratings and Reviews
content: After completing a course, learners can rate it from 1 to 5 stars and write a review. Ratings are visible on the course listing page and help future learners decide.

title: Types of Assessments
content: The platform has four assessment types: Practice Quizzes which are ungraded self-checks, Graded Quizzes which are scored and count toward grade, Assignments which are peer or instructor reviewed, and Final Exams which are required for certification.

title: Practice Quizzes
content: Practice quizzes are ungraded exercises at the end of lessons to help learners self-assess understanding. They can be retaken unlimited times with no penalty.

title: Graded Quizzes
content: Graded quizzes are scored and contribute to your overall course grade. Each quiz has a time limit of typically 20-40 minutes and a limited number of attempts usually 2-3.

title: Quiz Attempt Policy
content: Most graded quizzes allow 2-3 attempts. The highest score across attempts is recorded. A 24-hour cooling period may apply between attempts to encourage review.

title: Assignment Submission
content: Assignments are submitted via the course portal. Accepted formats include PDF, DOCX, and ZIP files. Late submissions may receive a penalty as defined in the course syllabus.

title: Peer Review Process
content: Some assignments use peer review. Learners evaluate each other's submissions using a rubric provided by the instructor. Each submission receives 3 peer reviews and an average score.

title: Final Exam Format
content: Final exams are timed auto-graded tests covering all course modules. They are typically 60-90 minutes long and allow only 1-2 attempts. Some are proctored online.

title: Passing Score Requirements
content: The minimum passing score varies by course but is typically 70 percent. Some certification tracks require 80 percent or higher. Check the course syllabus for exact passing thresholds.

title: Grade Calculation
content: Final grades are a weighted average: Quizzes count for 30 percent, Assignments count for 40 percent, and Final Exam counts for 30 percent. Weightings may differ per course so always check the syllabus.

title: Retaking Assessments
content: If you fail a graded assessment you may retake it based on the attempt limit. For final exams a retake may require waiting 7 days and possibly re-enrolling in the course.

title: Academic Integrity Policy
content: All assessments must be completed independently unless stated otherwise. Sharing quiz or exam questions externally is prohibited and may result in course removal or account ban.

title: Proctored Exam Rules
content: Proctored exams require a webcam, microphone, and a quiet environment. AI proctoring monitors activity during the exam. Notes and external resources are not permitted.

title: Certification Overview
content: Upon passing all assessments and completing all modules, learners earn a digital certificate of completion. Certificates are issued by the platform and optionally by partner institutions.

title: Certificate Eligibility
content: To be eligible for a certificate learners must complete all required lessons, pass all graded quizzes, submit all assignments, and pass the final exam with the required score.

title: Certificate Issuance Timeline
content: Certificates are generated automatically within 24-48 hours after all requirements are met. Learners receive an email notification with a download link.

title: Certificate Download and Sharing
content: Certificates can be downloaded as PDF from the My Certificates section of your profile. A shareable URL is also provided for LinkedIn and other professional networks.

title: Certificate Verification
content: Each certificate has a unique ID and QR code. Employers and institutions can verify authenticity by entering the certificate ID on the verification portal.

title: Specialization Certificate
content: Specialization tracks consist of 3-6 related courses. Completing all courses in a track earns a Specialization Certificate which carries more weight than individual course certificates.

title: Professional Certification Exams
content: Some courses lead to industry-recognized certifications. These require separate proctored exams registered through third-party certification bodies such as AWS or Google Cloud.

title: Certificate Expiry and Renewal
content: Platform certificates of completion do not expire. However industry certifications such as AWS or Google Cloud may have validity periods and require periodic renewal.

title: Re-certification Policy
content: If a learner fails to pass the final exam within allowed attempts they must re-enroll after a 30-day waiting period. Re-enrollment fees may apply for paid courses.

title: Progress Tracking Overview
content: The My Learning dashboard shows overall course completion percentage, module-by-module progress, and assessment scores. Progress is updated in real time as lessons are completed.

title: Lesson Completion Criteria
content: A lesson is marked complete when the learner watches at least 90 percent of the video or reads all sections of a reading. Simply opening a lesson does not count as completion.

title: Module Completion Criteria
content: A module is marked complete when all its lessons are completed and any required quizzes are submitted. Optional exercises do not block module completion.

title: Course Completion Percentage
content: The course completion percentage is calculated as completed lessons plus submitted assessments divided by total lessons plus total assessments multiplied by 100. It is displayed on the dashboard.

title: Streak and Learning Goals
content: Learners can set daily or weekly learning goals such as 30 minutes per day. The platform tracks learning streaks and sends reminders if goals are missed.

title: Activity Log
content: The Activity Log shows a history of lessons watched, quizzes taken, and assignments submitted with timestamps. It is accessible from the Profile Activity section.

title: Certificates vs Progress
content: Progress reflects content consumption while certificates reflect assessment performance. A learner can have 100 percent progress but still need to pass the final exam to earn a certificate.

title: Progress Reset Policy
content: Progress cannot be manually reset by learners. If a course is significantly updated the platform may prompt learners to revisit new content without erasing prior progress.

title: Mobile Progress Sync
content: Progress syncs across all devices in real time. Lessons completed on the mobile app are reflected immediately on the web dashboard and vice versa.

title: Course Withdrawal and Refund
content: Learners can withdraw from a course within 7 days of enrollment for a full refund if less than 20 percent of the course has been completed. After that no refunds are issued.

title: Language and Subtitle Options
content: Courses are offered primarily in English. Many courses include subtitles in Spanish, French, Hindi, and Mandarin. Subtitle language can be toggled in the video player settings.

title: Feedback on Assessments
content: After submitting a quiz or assignment learners receive automated feedback on incorrect answers explaining why an answer is wrong conceptually without revealing correct answers directly.

title: Employer Partnership Certificates
content: Some certifications are co-branded with hiring partners. Completing these courses adds learners to a talent pool reviewed by partner companies for job opportunities.

title: Instructor Gradebook
content: In instructor-led courses instructors can view each learner's grades, submission status, and overall progress via the Gradebook panel in their instructor dashboard.

title: Bookmarking and Notes
content: Learners can bookmark any video timestamp or reading section and add personal notes. All bookmarks and notes are saved to the My Notes section of the profile.

title: Assignment Plagiarism Check
content: All submitted assignments are scanned by a plagiarism detection system. If plagiarism is detected above 20 percent the submission is flagged for instructor review and may be rejected.

title: Certificate Name Correction
content: The name on your certificate is taken from your profile. To correct a name on an already-issued certificate update your profile and submit a certificate reissuance request via support.

title: Completion Email Notification
content: When a learner completes all modules and assessments an automatic congratulatory email is sent with a course completion summary and a link to download the certificate.

title: Technical Support and Help Desk
content: For technical issues such as video not loading, portal errors, or login problems learners can contact the Help Desk via live chat from 9am to 6pm or submit a support ticket. Response time is within 24 hours.
